title: F5R-TTS: Improving Flow Matching based Text-to-Speech with Group Relative Policy Optimization
author: Xiaohui Sun (Tencent), Ruitong Xiao (Tencent), Jianye Mo (Tencent), Bowen Wu (Tencent), Qun Yu (Tencent), Baoxun Wang (Tencent), ...
relevance_why: The paper presents advancements in text-to-speech synthesis, which directly aligns with Haohe Liu's interests in audio and speech processing, especially the reinforcement learning techniques that can potentially enhance speech generation models.
background: Improving text-to-speech synthesis using reinforcement learning techniques to achieve better speech intelligibility and speaker similarity.
contribution: F5R-TTS introduces a novel integration of Gradient Reward Policy Optimization (GRPO) into a flow-matching based text-to-speech system, significantly improving semantic accuracy and speaker similarity metrics.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous flow-matching text-to-speech models did not effectively incorporate reinforcement learning, limiting their adaptability and performance in complex audio tasks.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work effectively transforms deterministic outputs into probabilistic representations, facilitating the application of GRPO for improved training.

key_innovation: The model reformulates outputs as probabilistic distributions, enabling seamless integration of reinforcement learning to optimize text-to-speech synthesis.
real_world_impact: Enhancements in text-to-speech synthesis can lead to more natural and intelligible speech applications, benefiting voice cloning technologies and virtual assistants.

new_terms.Gradient Reward Policy Optimization (GRP: **Gradient Reward Policy Optimization** is a reinforcement learning strategy focused on optimizing policy models by leveraging advantages from group-relative rewards.
new_terms.flow-matching: **Flow-matching** refers to a technique that aligns distributions through probabilistic modeling to generate high-quality audio outputs.
